meanings.definition: To write or print (a letter, word, or symbol) above or on something else.
meanings.sent1: She superscribed her name on the envelope.
meanings.sent2: The artist superscribed a message on the painting.
meanings.sent3: The cat superscribed its paw prints on the wet cement.
meanings.sent4: His love for her was superscribed in every letter he wrote.
meanings.sent5: The memory of that day was superscribed in her mind forever.

meanings.definition: To sign (a document) at the end.
meanings.sent1: He superscribed the contract after reading it.
meanings.sent2: The author superscribed the book before handing it to the fan.
meanings.sent3: The dog superscribed the adoption papers with a paw print.
meanings.sent4: Her commitment was superscribed in every signature she made.
meanings.sent5: The importance of the moment was superscribed in his signature.
